parameters.name: BR
parameters.description:
KRTP radial (r) component of the magnetic-field in nT. R is along the   
      Saturn to spacecraft line, positive away from Saturn.

parameters.name: BTHETA
parameters.description:
KRTP southward (theta) component of the magnetic field in nT. Theta     
      completes the right handed set (Phi x R) and is positive southward.

parameters.name: BPHI
parameters.description:
KRTP azimuthal (phi) component of the magnetic field in nT. Phi is      
      parallel to Saturn's equator, perpendicular to the Saturn-spacecraft    
      line (Omega x R).

parameters.name: BTOTAL
parameters.description: Average of the magnetic field magnitudes in nT.

parameters.name: RANGE
parameters.description:
Range from Saturn center of mass to the spacecraft in units of Rs =     
      60268 km.

parameters.name: LATITUDE
parameters.description: Planetographic latitude of the spacecraft in degrees.

parameters.name: EAST LONGITUDE
parameters.description: Planetographic east longitude of the spacecraft in degrees.

parameters.name: LOCAL HOUR
parameters.description:
Angle between the observer's (Cassini) sub-Saturn meridian and the      
      anti-sunward meridian, measured in Saturn's equatorial plane in the     
      direction of planetary rotation. The local hour angle is converted to a 
      decimal hour (one hour equal to fifteen degrees longitude). The sun     
      meridian is defined to be noon (12.000), with midnight (0.000) opposite 
      it. Dawn (6.000) and dusk (18.000) are where the sun rises and sets     
      according to the planet's rotation.

parameters.name: NPTS
parameters.description: Number of points in the average.
